basics.name: Benjamin Noah Lugon-Moulin
basics.label: Robotics & Aerospace Engineering
basics.summary: Robotics + perception engineer. Building slip-aware localization, fast CV pipelines, and pragmatic hardware for autonomy.

work.name: NASA Ames Research Center (VIPER Mission)
work.summary: Slip-aware localization R&D and nighttime field testing for VIPER.
highlights: Developed a learning algorithm that reduced rover localization error by >41%.
Ran nighttime test ops and data collection; delivered statistical ops guidance to rover drivers.
Benchmarked VO/ICP pipelines in polar lighting and high-slip terrains.

work.name: Laboratory of Intelligent Systems (EPFL)
work.summary: VO-augmented GPS for UAVs (ROS integration + onboard camera hardware).
highlights: Augmented GPS localization with Visual Odometry (VO).
Designed camera mount HW and integrated VO software in ROS.

work.name: Home Tennis Club
work.summary: Coached kids and adults across leisure and competition levels.
highlights: 6+ years of coaching and event staffing.
Led interclubs team and supported 5+ events/year.
Thesis: In-Situ Slip Learning for Lunar Rover Localization (conducted at NASA Ames).
Student associations: Mars rover design team; exchange student network.
Built a quadruped robot as graduation project.

projects.name: EPFL Interdisciplinary Robot Competition
projects.summary: Autonomous toy-collecting robot; 2nd place + design award.
highlights: Led E-component selection & integration; C++ low-level control; perception-actuation loop.

projects.name: Xplore Mars Rover Student Team
projects.summary: Manipulator control + synthetic 6D pose data generation.
highlights: PID tuner in Matlab/Simulink for a 6-DOF arm.
Blender-generated synthetic dataset with pose labels.

projects.name: Rocket Recovery System Lead
projects.summary: On-board avionics for apogee detection + parachute deployment.
highlights: Validated by drone flights; successful field recoveries.
